item.title: The NSA Warns That US Adversaries Free to Mine Private Data May Have an AI Edge
item.description: Gilbert Herrera, who leads research at the National Security Agency, says large language models are incredibly useful—and a bit of a headache—for America’s intelligence machine.
item.media:keywords: Fast Forward, NSA, National Security Agency, national security, artificial intelligence, privacy, data, surveillance, intelligence, cybersecurity
item.dc:creator: Will Knight
item.dc:subject: Fast Forward

item.title: Perplexity's Founder Was Inspired by Sundar Pichai. Now They’re Competing to Reinvent Search
item.description: Aravind Srinivas grew up in the same city as Google’s CEO and developed an obsession with the company long before launching his own AI search startup.
item.media:keywords: Google, artificial intelligence, machine learning, Search, algorithms, deep learning, Sundar Pichai, Startups
item.dc:creator: Lauren Goode
item.dc:subject: Life Goals

item.title: The Filmmaker Who Says AI Is Reparations
item.description: Before he used AI tools to make his movies, Willonius Hatcher couldn’t get noticed. Now his AI-generated shorts are going viral and Hollywood is calling.
item.dc:creator: Jason Parham

item.title: Here’s Proof You Can Train an AI Model Without Slurping Copyrighted Content
item.description: OpenAI claimed it’s “impossible” to build good AI models without using copyrighted data. An “ethically created” large language model and a giant AI dataset of public domain text suggest otherwise.
item.media:keywords: artificial intelligence, algorithms, machine learning, ethics, OpenAI, Copyright and Copyfight, Copyright
item.dc:creator: Kate Knibbs
item.dc:subject: Fair Points

item.title: 8 Google Employees Invented Modern AI. Here’s the Inside Story
item.description: They met by chance, got hooked on an idea, and wrote the “Transformers” paper—the most consequential tech breakthrough in recent history.
item.media:keywords: longreads, artificial intelligence, Google, ChatGPT, OpenAI, chatbots, algorithms
item.dc:creator: Steven Levy
item.dc:subject: Attention!

item.title: Apple’s MM1 AI Model Shows a Sleeping Giant Is Waking Up
item.description: A research paper quietly released by Apple describes an AI model called MM1 that can answer questions and analyze images. It’s the biggest sign yet that Apple is developing generative AI capabilities.
item.media:keywords: apple, iPhone, Siri, ChatGPT, Google Gemini, Google, Search, OpenAI, artificial intelligence
item.dc:creator: Will Knight
item.dc:subject: Playing Catchup

item.title: Google DeepMind's New AI Model Can Help Soccer Teams Take the Perfect Corner
item.description: TacticAI, a soccer AI model created by Google DeepMind, makes predictions about where corners will go, and suggests tweaks to make goals more—or less—likely.
item.media:keywords: science, artificial intelligence, Google, machine learning, soccer, Sports
item.dc:creator: Amit Katwala
item.dc:subject: Neural Net

item.title: What Happens When a Guy and His AI Girlfriend Go to Therapy
item.description: In Sierra Greer's new novel, Annie Bot, a man named Doug finds out what it means to have the “perfect” girlfriend.
item.media:keywords: Book Excerpt, Books, artificial intelligence, mental health, relationships
item.dc:creator: Sierra Greer
item.dc:subject: Book Excerpt

item.title: Kids’ Cartoons Get a Free Pass From YouTube’s Deepfake Disclosure Rules
item.description: YouTube now requires a label for some generative AI content. Animations made for kids are exempt.
item.media:keywords: YouTube, artificial intelligence, kids, children, Deepfakes, Google, search engines, ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Kate Knibbs
item.dc:subject: Minor Oversight

item.title: Reddit’s Sale of User Data for AI Training Draws FTC Inquiry
item.description: The platform says it stands to make more than $200 million in coming years from Google and other companies that want user comments to feed AI projects. Regulators have questions.
item.media:keywords: reddit, Social Media, artificial intelligence, Google, data, data privacy, privacy, FTC, Regulation
item.dc:creator: Paresh Dave
item.dc:subject: You Did What Now?
